messages.content: Angus Robertson is widely recognised as the leader of effective opposition at Westminster. He has been rated as 'Scotland's hardest working MP' and has twice been awarded 'Best Scot at Westminster.'
He has been effective in raising the issues that matter for Moray, Scotland, the UK, and the wider world.
While the Tories were considering closing both Kinloss and Lossiemouth, it was Angus Robertson who provided a strong voice in Parliament to defend the bases.
Angus and his office staff have helped thousands of people through Moray. He works closely with Richard Lochhead MSP and local councillors as a high-profile team providing a strong voice for Moray.
The General Election on the 8th June is Scotland's opportunity to make our voice heard loudly and clearly.
The Tories plan to drag Scotland towards a damaging hard Brexit, which neither 'Remain' nor 'Leave' supporters voted for. They will not return all powers to Scotland that we were promised.
More Tory austerity cuts are coming our way and they plan to attack pensions.
The SNP will fight tooth and nail against further cuts and to ensure that all in society are protected not just the wealthy.
As your MP Angus Robertson has been an outstanding servant for Moray.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Angus is a strong advocate for key services such as the Royal Mail. He opposed its privatisation and the reductions in postal obligation, which is so important for the north of Scotland.

Angus is a vocal supporter of the Moray economy. He has worked with the SNP Scottish Government to deliver record investment, including flood alleviation, road and rail improvements, as well as business relief and support.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Pensions and pensioners are under attack by Theresa May and the Tories
keyPolicies.policyDescription: When put on the spot at Westminster about the pensions triple-lock, the Prime Minister refused to give guarantees.
